Key Match Events: Jude Bellingham's acrobatic strike and Harry Kane's powerful header rescued England from being dumped out of the competition by Slovakia on Sunday
Pre-Game Insights: England meets Switzerland in Saturday's quarterfinal in Dusseldorf
The winner of that game will take on either the Netherlands, Romania, Austria or Turkey in the semifinal
Post-Match Reflections: Rice told how some of the abuse hurled at Southgate, including doubts of his methods from public and press, and cups thrown at him by angry supporters, was proving to be a motivating point for the players
England vs. Slovakia: MINI-MOVIE of England's epic comeback
Miscellaneous Highlights: Although it took an extra 30 minutes of extra time, Sunday's win was the first time England had scored more than two goals in a game at the tournament
Others: England's David Seaman saved a penalty against Scotland in 1996, and an emotional journey was off and running
England's World Cup semifinal run in 1990 saw the team need David Platt's last-minute extra-time winner against Belgium and a come-from-behind win against Cameroon
